channel.title: Help with these 2 erros in clickingbuttons.java
channel.description:
Title says all :\ im trying to add a npc that resets stats and im on my last part and I get this error help me please thanks =]
[code=java]src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:870: not a statement c.dialogueAction == 42) { //prayer ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:870: ';' expected c.dialogueAction == 42) { //prayer ^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

item.title: Help with these 2 erros in clickingbuttons.java
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“jaruanna, post:46, topic:401741”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=498798.msg3648278#msg3648278 date=1309544508]

Well, http://pastebin.com/dB7vU2be is his file.

I’m a bit confused as to why it’s not set, because the way it calls npcType works in the standard PI.

That’s one of the things I dislike about switch statements is that you can’t define similarly named variables in different cases.

My suggestion would be in this case, to remove the npcType and explicitly define the numbers.
[/quote]

I give you lots of credit Zyle, you’ve been going on this topic for a while now.[/quote]

So has I Vain I.

This is the help section. It’s where people come for help. I’ll help people as much as I can, until they understand. But I will not give them the answer. Then they wouldn’t learn.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with these 2 erros in clickingbuttons.java

Well, http://pastebin.com/dB7vU2be is his file.

I’m a bit confused as to why it’s not set, because the way it calls npcType works in the standard PI.
[/quote]

That’s one of the things I dislike about switch statements is that you can’t define similarly named variables in different cases.

My suggestion would be in this case, to remove the npcType and explicitly define the numbers.[/quote]

item.title: Help with these 2 erros in clickingbuttons.java
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Well, http://pastebin.com/dB7vU2be is his file.

I’m a bit confused as to why it’s not set, because the way it calls npcType works in the standard PI.[/quote]

That’s one of the things I dislike about switch statements is that you can’t define similarly named variables in different cases.

My suggestion would be in this case, to remove the npcType and explicitly define the numbers.

item.title: Help with these 2 erros in clickingbuttons.java
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Guhtwables:

can u help on tv?

No. This is not a section where you can vaguely describe a problem, and request someone to fix it for you remotely. That’s not how forums work. You post the problem here, and various people put in their input on the problem, in order to reach a solution.

If you’re having a problem, then please let us know. It will help us better ourselves to help others in the future. But know that no one will fix your problems for you; just like in the real world.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with these 2 erros in clickingbuttons.java
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Guhtwables, post:24, topic:401741”]now i got this error…

src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:876: variable npcType migh t not have been initialized c.getDH().sendDialogues(420, npc Type); ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:887: variable npcType migh t not have been initialized c.getDH().sendDialogues(260, npcType); ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]

Basically what the error says is that your code looks something like this:

int npcType;
c.getDH().sendDialogues(420, npcType);

npcType was not set to an initial value, and so the program would be sending a variable with no value.

You MUST set a variable to an initial value when you define it. Or else, as you can see, the program won’t compile.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with these 2 erros in clickingbuttons.java
